    3382             :     // An optional type
    3383             :     template<typename T>
    3384             :     class Option {
    3385             :     public:
    3386           5 :         Option() : nullableValue( nullptr ) {}
    3387             :         Option( T const& _value )
    3388             :         : nullableValue( new( storage ) T( _value ) )
    3389             :         {}
    3390             :         Option( Option const& _other )
    3391             :         : nullableValue( _other ? new( storage ) T( *_other ) : nullptr )
    3392             :         {}
    3393             : 
    3394           5 :         ~Option() {
    3395           5 :             reset();
    3396           5 :         }
    3397             : 
    3398             :         Option& operator= ( Option const& _other ) {
    3399             :             if( &_other != this ) {
    3400             :                 reset();
    3401             :                 if( _other )
    3402             :                     nullableValue = new( storage ) T( *_other );
    3403             :             }
    3404             :             return *this;
    3405             :         }
    3406           4 :         Option& operator = ( T const& _value ) {
    3407           4 :             reset();
    3408           4 :             nullableValue = new( storage ) T( _value );
    3409           4 :             return *this;
    3410             :         }
    3411             : 
    3412          15 :         void reset() {
    3413          15 :             if( nullableValue )
    3414           4 :                 nullableValue->~T();
    3415          15 :             nullableValue = nullptr;
    3416          15 :         }
    3417             : 
    3418           0 :         T& operator*() { return *nullableValue; }
    3419           0 :         T const& operator*() const { return *nullableValue; }
    3420           0 :         T* operator->() { return nullableValue; }
    3421             :         const T* operator->() const { return nullableValue; }
    3422             : 
    3423           0 :         T valueOr( T const& defaultValue ) const {
    3424           0 :             return nullableValue ? *nullableValue : defaultValue;
    3425             :         }
    3426             : 
    3427           1 :         bool some() const { return nullableValue != nullptr; }
    3428             :         bool none() const { return nullableValue == nullptr; }
    3429             : 
    3430             :         bool operator !() const { return nullableValue == nullptr; }
    3431           1 :         explicit operator bool() const {
    3432           1 :             return some();
    3433             :         }
    3434             : 
    3435             :     private:
    3436             :         T *nullableValue;
    3437             :         alignas(alignof(T)) char storage[sizeof(T)];
    3438             :     };

    3738             :     template<typename DerivedT>
    3739             :     struct CumulativeReporterBase : IStreamingReporter {
    3740             :         template<typename T, typename ChildNodeT>
    3741             :         struct Node {
    3742           0 :             explicit Node( T const& _value ) : value( _value ) {}
    3743           0 :             virtual ~Node() {}
    3744             : 
    3745             :             using ChildNodes = std::vector<std::shared_ptr<ChildNodeT>>;
    3746             :             T value;
    3747             :             ChildNodes children;
    3748             :         };
    3749             :         struct SectionNode {
    3750           0 :             explicit SectionNode(SectionStats const& _stats) : stats(_stats) {}
    3751           0 :             virtual ~SectionNode() = default;
    3752             : 
    3753             :             bool operator == (SectionNode const& other) const {
    3754             :                 return stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo == other.stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo;
    3755             :             }
    3756             :             bool operator == (std::shared_ptr<SectionNode> const& other) const {
    3757             :                 return operator==(*other);
    3758             :             }
    3759             : 
    3760             :             SectionStats stats;
    3761             :             using ChildSections = std::vector<std::shared_ptr<SectionNode>>;
    3762             :             using Assertions = std::vector<AssertionStats>;
    3763             :             ChildSections childSections;
    3764             :             Assertions assertions;
    3765             :             std::string stdOut;
    3766             :             std::string stdErr;
    3767             :         };
    3768             : 
    3769             :         struct BySectionInfo {
    3770           0 :             BySectionInfo( SectionInfo const& other ) : m_other( other ) {}
    3771           0 :             BySectionInfo( BySectionInfo const& other ) : m_other( other.m_other ) {}
    3772           0 :             bool operator() (std::shared_ptr<SectionNode> const& node) const {
    3773           0 :                 return ((node->stats.sectionInfo.name == m_other.name) &&
    3774           0 :                         (node->stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo == m_other.lineInfo));
    3775             :             }
    3776             :             void operator=(BySectionInfo const&) = delete;
    3777             : 
    3778             :         private:
    3779             :             SectionInfo const& m_other;
    3780             :         };
    3781             : 
    3782             :         using TestCaseNode = Node<TestCaseStats, SectionNode>;
    3783             :         using TestGroupNode = Node<TestGroupStats, TestCaseNode>;
    3784             :         using TestRunNode = Node<TestRunStats, TestGroupNode>;
    3785             : 
    3786           0 :         CumulativeReporterBase( ReporterConfig const& _config )
    3787             :         :   m_config( _config.fullConfig() ),
    3788           0 :             stream( _config.stream() )
    3789             :         {
    3790           0 :             m_reporterPrefs.shouldRedirectStdOut = false;
    3791           0 :             if( !DerivedT::getSupportedVerbosities().count( m_config->verbosity() ) )
    3792           0 :                 throw std::domain_error( "Verbosity level not supported by this reporter" );
    3793           0 :         }
    3794           0 :         ~CumulativeReporterBase() override = default;
    3795             : 
    3796           0 :         ReporterPreferences getPreferences() const override {
    3797           0 :             return m_reporterPrefs;
    3798             :         }
    3799             : 
    3800           0 :         static std::set<Verbosity> getSupportedVerbosities() {
    3801           0 :             return { Verbosity::Normal };
    3802             :         }
    3803             : 
    3804           0 :         void testRunStarting( TestRunInfo const& ) override {}
    3805           0 :         void testGroupStarting( GroupInfo const& ) override {}
    3806             :

    3808             : 
    3809           0 :         void sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) override {
    3810           0 :             SectionStats incompleteStats( sectionInfo, Counts(), 0, false );
    3811           0 :             std::shared_ptr<SectionNode> node;
    3812           0 :             if( m_sectionStack.empty() ) {
    3813           0 :                 if( !m_rootSection )
    3814           0 :                     m_rootSection = std::make_shared<SectionNode>( incompleteStats );
    3815           0 :                 node = m_rootSection;
    3816             :             }
    3817             :             else {
    3818           0 :                 SectionNode& parentNode = *m_sectionStack.back();
    3819             :                 auto it =
    3820           0 :                     std::find_if(   parentNode.childSections.begin(),
    3821             :                                     parentNode.childSections.end(),
    3822           0 :                                     BySectionInfo( sectionInfo ) );
    3823           0 :                 if( it == parentNode.childSections.end() ) {
    3824           0 :                     node = std::make_shared<SectionNode>( incompleteStats );
    3825           0 :                     parentNode.childSections.push_back( node );
    3826             :                 }
    3827             :                 else
    3828           0 :                     node = *it;
    3829             :             }
    3830           0 :             m_sectionStack.push_back( node );
    3831           0 :             m_deepestSection = std::move(node);
    3832           0 :         }
    3833             : 
    3834           0 :         void assertionStarting(AssertionInfo const&) override {}
    3835             : 
    3836           0 :         bool assertionEnded(AssertionStats const& assertionStats) override {
    3837           0 :             assert(!m_sectionStack.empty());
    3838             :             // AssertionResult holds a pointer to a temporary DecomposedExpression,
    3839             :             // which getExpandedExpression() calls to build the expression string.
    3840             :             // Our section stack copy of the assertionResult will likely outlive the
    3841             :             // temporary, so it must be expanded or discarded now to avoid calling
    3842             :             // a destroyed object later.
    3843           0 :             prepareExpandedExpression(const_cast<AssertionResult&>( assertionStats.assertionResult ) );
    3844           0 :             SectionNode& sectionNode = *m_sectionStack.back();
    3845           0 :             sectionNode.assertions.push_back(assertionStats);
    3846           0 :             return true;
    3847             :         }
    3848           0 :         void sectionEnded(SectionStats const& sectionStats) override {
    3849           0 :             assert(!m_sectionStack.empty());
    3850           0 :             SectionNode& node = *m_sectionStack.back();
    3851           0 :             node.stats = sectionStats;
    3852           0 :             m_sectionStack.pop_back();
    3853           0 :         }
    3854           0 :         void testCaseEnded(TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats) override {
    3855           0 :             auto node = std::make_shared<TestCaseNode>(testCaseStats);
    3856           0 :             assert(m_sectionStack.size() == 0);
    3857           0 :             node->children.push_back(m_rootSection);
    3858           0 :             m_testCases.push_back(node);
    3859           0 :             m_rootSection.reset();
    3860             : 
    3861           0 :             assert(m_deepestSection);
    3862           0 :             m_deepestSection->stdOut = testCaseStats.stdOut;
    3863           0 :             m_deepestSection->stdErr = testCaseStats.stdErr;
    3864           0 :         }
    3865           0 :         void testGroupEnded(TestGroupStats const& testGroupStats) override {
    3866           0 :             auto node = std::make_shared<TestGroupNode>(testGroupStats);
    3867           0 :             node->children.swap(m_testCases);
    3868           0 :             m_testGroups.push_back(node);
    3869           0 :         }
    3870           0 :         void testRunEnded(TestRunStats const& testRunStats) override {
    3871           0 :             auto node = std::make_shared<TestRunNode>(testRunStats);
    3872           0 :             node->children.swap(m_testGroups);
    3873           0 :             m_testRuns.push_back(node);
    3874           0 :             testRunEndedCumulative();
    3875           0 :         }
    3876             :         virtual void testRunEndedCumulative() = 0;
    3877             : 
    3878           0 :         void skipTest(TestCaseInfo const&) override {}
    3879             : 
    3880             :         IConfigPtr m_config;
    3881             :         std::ostream& stream;
    3882             :         std::vector<AssertionStats> m_assertions;
    3883             :         std::vector<std::vector<std::shared_ptr<SectionNode>>> m_sections;
    3884             :         std::vector<std::shared_ptr<TestCaseNode>> m_testCases;
    3885             :         std::vector<std::shared_ptr<TestGroupNode>> m_testGroups;
    3886             : 
    3887             :         std::vector<std::shared_ptr<TestRunNode>> m_testRuns;
    3888             : 
    3889             :         std::shared_ptr<SectionNode> m_rootSection;
    3890             :         std::shared_ptr<SectionNode> m_deepestSection;
    3891             :         std::vector<std::shared_ptr<SectionNode>> m_sectionStack;
    3892             :         ReporterPreferences m_reporterPrefs;
    3893             :     };
    3894             : 
    3895             :     template<char C>
    3896           0 :     char const* getLineOfChars() {
    3897             :         static char line[CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH] = {0};
    3898           0 :         if( !*line ) {
    3899           0 :             std::memset( line, C, CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1 );
    3900           0 :             line[CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1] = 0;
    3901             :         }
    3902           0 :         return line;
    3903             :     }

    3942             :             ResultError = BrightRed,
    3943             :             ResultSuccess = BrightGreen,

    3951             : 
    3952             :             SecondaryText = LightGrey,
    3953             :             Headers = White
    3954             :         };

    3960             :         ~Colour();

    4362             :     struct ITracker;
    4363             :

    4365             : 
    4366          18 :     struct ITracker {
    4367             :         virtual ~ITracker();
    4368             : 
    4369             :         // static queries
    4370             :         virtual NameAndLocation const& nameAndLocation() const = 0;
    4371             : 
    4372             :         // dynamic queries
    4373             :         virtual bool isComplete() const = 0; // Successfully completed or failed

    4530             : 
    4531             : #include <cmath>
    4532             : #include <limits>
    4533             : 
    4534             : namespace {
    4535             : 
    4536             : // Performs equivalent check of std::fabs(lhs - rhs) <= margin
    4537             : // But without the subtraction to allow for INFINITY in comparison
    4538           0 : bool marginComparison(double lhs, double rhs, double margin) {
    4539           0 :     return (lhs + margin >= rhs) && (rhs + margin >= lhs);
    4540             : }
    4541             : 
    4542             : }
    4543             : 
    4544             : namespace Catch {
    4545             : namespace Detail {
    4546             : 
    4547           0 :     Approx::Approx ( double value )
    4548           0 :     :   m_epsilon( std::numeric_limits<float>::epsilon()*100 ),
    4549             :         m_margin( 0.0 ),
    4550             :         m_scale( 0.0 ),
    4551           0 :         m_value( value )
    4552           0 :     {}
    4553             : 
    4554           0 :     Approx Approx::custom() {
    4555           0 :         return Approx( 0 );
    4556             :     }
    4557             : 
    4558           0 :     std::string Approx::toString() const {
    4559           0 :         ReusableStringStream rss;
    4560           0 :         rss << "Approx( " << ::Catch::Detail::stringify( m_value ) << " )";
    4561           0 :         return rss.str();
    4562             :     }
    4563             : 
    4564           0 :     bool Approx::equalityComparisonImpl(const double other) const {
    4565             :         // First try with fixed margin, then compute margin based on epsilon, scale and Approx's value
    4566             :         // Thanks to Richard Harris for his help refining the scaled margin value
    4567           0 :         return marginComparison(m_value, other, m_margin) || marginComparison(m_value, other, m_epsilon * (m_scale + std::fabs(m_value)));
    4568             :     }
    4569             : 
    4570             : } // end namespace Detail
    4571             : 
    4572           0 : std::string StringMaker<Catch::Detail::Approx>::convert(Catch::Detail::Approx const& value) {
    4573           0 :     return value.toString();
    4574             : }
    4575             : 
    4576             : } // end namespace Catch

    4637             : 
    4638             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
    4639             : 
    4640             :     #define CATCH_TRAP() __asm__("int $3\n" : : ) /* NOLINT */
    4641             : 
    4642             : #elif defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX)
    4643             :     // If we can use inline assembler, do it because this allows us to break
    4644             :     // directly at the location of the failing check instead of breaking inside
    4645             :     // raise() called from it, i.e. one stack frame below.
    4646             :     #if defined(__GNUC__) && (defined(__i386) || defined(__x86_64))
    4647             :         #define CATCH_TRAP() asm volatile ("int $3") /* NOLINT */
    4648             :     #else // Fall back to the generic way.
    4649             :         #include <signal.h>
    4650             : 
    4651             :         #define CATCH_TRAP() raise(SIGTRAP)
    4652             :     #endif
    4653             : #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
    4654             :     #define CATCH_TRAP() __debugbreak()
    4655             : #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
    4656             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) void __stdcall DebugBreak();
    4657             :     #define CATCH_TRAP() DebugBreak()
    4658             : #endif
    4659             : 
    4660             : #ifdef CATCH_TRAP
    4661             :     #define CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() if( Catch::isDebuggerActive() ) { CATCH_TRAP(); }
    4662             : #else
    4663             :     namespace Catch {
    4664             :         inline void doNothing() {}
    4665             :     }
    4666             :     #define CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() Catch::doNothing()
    4667             : #endif
    4668             :

    4885           0 :     LazyExpression::LazyExpression( bool isNegated )

    4887           0 :     {}
    4888             : 
    4889           0 :     LazyExpression::LazyExpression( LazyExpression const& other ) : m_isNegated( other.m_isNegated ) {}
    4890             : 
    4891           0 :     LazyExpression::operator bool() const {
    4892           0 :         return m_transientExpression != nullptr;
    4893             :     }
    4894             : 
    4895           0 :     auto operator << ( std::ostream& os, LazyExpression const& lazyExpr ) -> std::ostream& {
    4896           0 :         if( lazyExpr.m_isNegated )
    4897           0 :             os << "!";
    4898             : 
    4899           0 :         if( lazyExpr ) {
    4900           0 :             if( lazyExpr.m_isNegated && lazyExpr.m_transientExpression->isBinaryExpression() )
    4901           0 :                 os << "(" << *lazyExpr.m_transientExpression << ")";
    4902             :             else
    4903           0 :                 os << *lazyExpr.m_transientExpression;
    4904             :         }
    4905             :         else {
    4906           0 :             os << "{** error - unchecked empty expression requested **}";
    4907             :         }
    4908           0 :         return os;
    4909             :     }
    4910             :

    4925           0 :     }
    4926             : 
    4927           0 :     auto AssertionHandler::allowThrows() const -> bool {
    4928           0 :         return getCurrentContext().getConfig()->allowThrows();
    4929             :     }
    4930             : 
    4931          19 :     void AssertionHandler::complete() {
    4932          19 :         setCompleted();
    4933          19 :         if( m_reaction.shouldDebugBreak ) {
    4934             : 
    4935             :             // If you find your debugger stopping you here then go one level up on the
    4936             :             // call-stack for the code that caused it (typically a failed assertion)
    4937             : 
    4938             :             // (To go back to the test and change execution, jump over the throw, next)
    4939           0 :             CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER();
    4940             :         }
    4941          19 :         if( m_reaction.shouldThrow )
    4942           0 :             throw Catch::TestFailureException();
    4943          19 :     }
    4944          19 :     void AssertionHandler::setCompleted() {
    4945          19 :         m_completed = true;
    4946          19 :     }
    4947             : 
    4948           0 :     void AssertionHandler::handleUnexpectedInflightException() {
    4949           0 :         m_resultCapture.handleUnexpectedInflightException( m_assertionInfo, Catch::translateActiveException(), m_reaction );
    4950           0 :     }
    4951             :

    5083           0 :             return true;
    5084             :         }

    5096             :     using StringMatcher = Matchers::Impl::MatcherBase<std::string>;
    5097             : 
    5098             :     // This is the general overload that takes a any string matcher
    5099             :     // There is another overload, in catch_assertionhandler.h/.cpp, that only takes a string and infers
    5100             :     // the Equals matcher (so the header does not mention matchers)
    5101           0 :     void handleExceptionMatchExpr( AssertionHandler& handler, StringMatcher const& matcher, StringRef matcherString  ) {
    5102           0 :         std::string exceptionMessage = Catch::translateActiveException();

    5104           0 :         handler.handleExpr( expr );
    5105           0 :     }

    5180           0 :     inline auto isWhitespace( char c ) -> bool {
    5181           0 :         static std::string chars = " \t\n\r";
    5182           0 :         return chars.find( c ) != std::string::npos;
    5183             :     }
    5184           0 :     inline auto isBreakableBefore( char c ) -> bool {
    5185           0 :         static std::string chars = "[({<|";
    5186           0 :         return chars.find( c ) != std::string::npos;
    5187             :     }
    5188           0 :     inline auto isBreakableAfter( char c ) -> bool {
    5189           0 :         static std::string chars = "])}>.,:;*+-=&/\\";
    5190           0 :         return chars.find( c ) != std::string::npos;
    5191             :     }
    5192             : 
    5193             :     class Columns;
    5194             : 
    5195           0 :     class Column {
    5196             :         std::vector<std::string> m_strings;
    5197             :         size_t m_width = CATCH_CLARA_TEXTFLOW_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH;
    5198             :         size_t m_indent = 0;
    5199             :         size_t m_initialIndent = std::string::npos;
    5200             : 
    5201             :     public:
    5202             :         class iterator {
    5203             :             friend Column;
    5204             : 
    5205             :             Column const& m_column;
    5206             :             size_t m_stringIndex = 0;
    5207             :             size_t m_pos = 0;
    5208             : 
    5209             :             size_t m_len = 0;
    5210             :             size_t m_end = 0;
    5211             :             bool m_suffix = false;
    5212             : 
    5213           0 :             iterator( Column const& column, size_t stringIndex )
    5214             :             :   m_column( column ),
    5215           0 :                 m_stringIndex( stringIndex )
    5216           0 :             {}
    5217             : 
    5218           0 :             auto line() const -> std::string const& { return m_column.m_strings[m_stringIndex]; }
    5219             : 
    5220           0 :             auto isBoundary( size_t at ) const -> bool {
    5221           0 :                 assert( at > 0 );
    5222           0 :                 assert( at <= line().size() );
    5223             : 
    5224           0 :                 return at == line().size() ||
    5225           0 :                        ( isWhitespace( line()[at] ) && !isWhitespace( line()[at-1] ) ) ||
    5226           0 :                        isBreakableBefore( line()[at] ) ||
    5227           0 :                        isBreakableAfter( line()[at-1] );
    5228             :             }
    5229             : 
    5230           0 :             void calcLength() {
    5231           0 :                 assert( m_stringIndex < m_column.m_strings.size() );
    5232             : 
    5233           0 :                 m_suffix = false;
    5234           0 :                 auto width = m_column.m_width-indent();
    5235           0 :                 m_end = m_pos;
    5236           0 :                 while( m_end < line().size() && line()[m_end] != '\n' )
    5237           0 :                     ++m_end;
    5238             : 
    5239           0 :                 if( m_end < m_pos + width ) {
    5240           0 :                     m_len = m_end - m_pos;
    5241             :                 }
    5242             :                 else {
    5243           0 :                     size_t len = width;
    5244           0 :                     while (len > 0 && !isBoundary(m_pos + len))
    5245           0 :                         --len;
    5246           0 :                     while (len > 0 && isWhitespace( line()[m_pos + len - 1] ))
    5247           0 :                         --len;
    5248             : 
    5249           0 :                     if (len > 0) {
    5250           0 :                         m_len = len;
    5251             :                     } else {
    5252           0 :                         m_suffix = true;
    5253           0 :                         m_len = width - 1;
    5254             :                     }
    5255             :                 }
    5256           0 :             }
    5257             : 
    5258           0 :             auto indent() const -> size_t {
    5259           0 :                 auto initial = m_pos == 0 && m_stringIndex == 0 ? m_column.m_initialIndent : std::string::npos;
    5260           0 :                 return initial == std::string::npos ? m_column.m_indent : initial;
    5261             :             }
    5262             : 
    5263           0 :             auto addIndentAndSuffix(std::string const &plain) const -> std::string {
    5264           0 :                 return std::string( indent(), ' ' ) + (m_suffix ? plain + "-" : plain);
    5265             :             }
    5266             : 
    5267             :         public:
    5268           0 :             explicit iterator( Column const& column ) : m_column( column ) {
    5269           0 :                 assert( m_column.m_width > m_column.m_indent );
    5270           0 :                 assert( m_column.m_initialIndent == std::string::npos || m_column.m_width > m_column.m_initialIndent );
    5271           0 :                 calcLength();
    5272           0 :                 if( m_len == 0 )
    5273           0 :                     m_stringIndex++; // Empty string
    5274           0 :             }
    5275             : 
    5276           0 :             auto operator *() const -> std::string {
    5277           0 :                 assert( m_stringIndex < m_column.m_strings.size() );
    5278           0 :                 assert( m_pos <= m_end );
    5279           0 :                 if( m_pos + m_column.m_width < m_end )
    5280           0 :                     return addIndentAndSuffix(line().substr(m_pos, m_len));
    5281             :                 else
    5282           0 :                     return addIndentAndSuffix(line().substr(m_pos, m_end - m_pos));
    5283             :             }
    5284             : 
    5285           0 :             auto operator ++() -> iterator& {
    5286           0 :                 m_pos += m_len;
    5287           0 :                 if( m_pos < line().size() && line()[m_pos] == '\n' )
    5288           0 :                     m_pos += 1;
    5289             :                 else
    5290           0 :                     while( m_pos < line().size() && isWhitespace( line()[m_pos] ) )
    5291           0 :                         ++m_pos;
    5292             : 
    5293           0 :                 if( m_pos == line().size() ) {
    5294           0 :                     m_pos = 0;
    5295           0 :                     ++m_stringIndex;
    5296             :                 }
    5297           0 :                 if( m_stringIndex < m_column.m_strings.size() )
    5298           0 :                     calcLength();
    5299           0 :                 return *this;
    5300             :             }

    5306             :

    5316             :         };

    5388           0 :                     m_iterators.push_back( col.end() );

    5390             : 
    5391             :         public:

    5393             :             :   m_columns( columns.m_columns ),
    5394           0 :                 m_activeIterators( m_columns.size() )
    5395             :             {
    5396           0 :                 m_iterators.reserve( m_columns.size() );
    5397             : 
    5398           0 :                 for( auto const& col : m_columns )
    5399           0 :                     m_iterators.push_back( col.begin() );
    5400           0 :             }
    5401             : 
    5402             :             auto operator ==( iterator const& other ) const -> bool {
    5403             :                 return m_iterators == other.m_iterators;
    5404             :             }
    5405           0 :             auto operator !=( iterator const& other ) const -> bool {
    5406           0 :                 return m_iterators != other.m_iterators;
    5407             :             }
    5408           0 :             auto operator *() const -> std::string {
    5409           0 :                 std::string row, padding;
    5410             : 
    5411           0 :                 for( size_t i = 0; i < m_columns.size(); ++i ) {
    5412           0 :                     auto width = m_columns[i].width();
    5413           0 :                     if( m_iterators[i] != m_columns[i].end() ) {
    5414           0 :                         std::string col = *m_iterators[i];
    5415           0 :                         row += padding + col;
    5416           0 :                         if( col.size() < width )
    5417           0 :                             padding = std::string( width - col.size(), ' ' );
    5418             :                         else
    5419           0 :                             padding = "";
    5420             :                     }
    5421             :                     else {
    5422           0 :                         padding += std::string( width, ' ' );
    5423             :                     }
    5424             :                 }
    5425           0 :                 return row;
    5426             :             }
    5427           0 :             auto operator ++() -> iterator& {
    5428           0 :                 for( size_t i = 0; i < m_columns.size(); ++i ) {
    5429           0 :                     if (m_iterators[i] != m_columns[i].end())
    5430           0 :                         ++m_iterators[i];
    5431             :                 }
    5432           0 :                 return *this;

    5536             :     // Wraps a token coming from a token stream. These may not directly correspond to strings as a single string
    5537             :     // may encode an option + its argument if the : or = form is used
    5538             :     enum class TokenType {
    5539             :         Option, Argument
    5540             :     };
    5541           0 :     struct Token {
    5542             :         TokenType type;
    5543             :         std::string token;
    5544             :     };
    5545             : 
    5546           0 :     inline auto isOptPrefix( char c ) -> bool {
    5547           0 :         return c == '-'
    5548             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
    5549             :             || c == '/'
    5550             : #endif
    5551             :         ;
    5552             :     }
    5553             : 
    5554             :     // Abstracts iterators into args as a stream of tokens, with option arguments uniformly handled
    5555           9 :     class TokenStream {
    5556             :         using Iterator = std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator;
    5557             :         Iterator it;
    5558             :         Iterator itEnd;
    5559             :         std::vector<Token> m_tokenBuffer;
    5560             : 
    5561           1 :         void loadBuffer() {
    5562           1 :             m_tokenBuffer.resize( 0 );
    5563             : 
    5564             :             // Skip any empty strings
    5565           1 :             while( it != itEnd && it->empty() )
    5566           0 :                 ++it;
    5567             : 
    5568           1 :             if( it != itEnd ) {
    5569           0 :                 auto const &next = *it;
    5570           0 :                 if( isOptPrefix( next[0] ) ) {
    5571           0 :                     auto delimiterPos = next.find_first_of( " :=" );
    5572           0 :                     if( delimiterPos != std::string::npos ) {
    5573           0 :                         m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Option, next.substr( 0, delimiterPos ) } );
    5574           0 :                         m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Argument, next.substr( delimiterPos + 1 ) } );
    5575             :                     } else {
    5576           0 :                         if( next[1] != '-' && next.size() > 2 ) {
    5577           0 :                             std::string opt = "- ";
    5578           0 :                             for( size_t i = 1; i < next.size(); ++i ) {
    5579           0 :                                 opt[1] = next[i];
    5580           0 :                                 m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Option, opt } );
    5581             :                             }
    5582             :                         } else {
    5583           0 :                             m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Option, next } );
    5584             :                         }
    5585             :                     }
    5586             :                 } else {
    5587           0 :                     m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Argument, next } );
    5588             :                 }
    5589             :             }
    5590           1 :         }
    5591             : 
    5592             :     public:
    5593           1 :         explicit TokenStream( Args const &args ) : TokenStream( args.m_args.begin(), args.m_args.end() ) {}
    5594             : 
    5595           1 :         TokenStream( Iterator it, Iterator itEnd ) : it( it ), itEnd( itEnd ) {
    5596           1 :             loadBuffer();
    5597           1 :         }
    5598             : 
    5599           1 :         explicit operator bool() const {
    5600           1 :             return !m_tokenBuffer.empty() || it != itEnd;
    5601             :         }
    5602             : 
    5603             :         auto count() const -> size_t { return m_tokenBuffer.size() + (itEnd - it); }
    5604             : 
    5605           0 :         auto operator*() const -> Token {
    5606           0 :             assert( !m_tokenBuffer.empty() );
    5607           0 :             return m_tokenBuffer.front();
    5608             :         }
    5609             : 
    5610           0 :         auto operator->() const -> Token const * {
    5611           0 :             assert( !m_tokenBuffer.empty() );
    5612           0 :             return &m_tokenBuffer.front();
    5613             :         }
    5614             : 
    5615           0 :         auto operator++() -> TokenStream & {
    5616           0 :             if( m_tokenBuffer.size() >= 2 ) {
    5617           0 :                 m_tokenBuffer.erase( m_tokenBuffer.begin() );
    5618             :             } else {
    5619           0 :                 if( it != itEnd )
    5620           0 :                     ++it;
    5621           0 :                 loadBuffer();
    5622             :             }
    5623           0 :             return *this;
    5624             :         }
    5625             :     };
    5626             :

    5776           0 :         std::string srcLC = source;

    5782             :         else

    6964           1 :         delete IMutableContext::currentContext;
    6965           1 :         IMutableContext::currentContext = nullptr;
    6966           1 :     }

    7002             : // start catch_debugger.cpp
    7003             : 
    7004             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
    7005             : 
    7006             : #  include <assert.h>
    7007             : #  include <stdbool.h>
    7008             : #  include <sys/types.h>
    7009             : #  include <unistd.h>
    7010             : #  include <sys/sysctl.h>
    7011             : #  include <cstddef>
    7012             : #  include <ostream>
    7013             : 
    7014             : namespace Catch {
    7015             : 
    7016             :         // The following function is taken directly from the following technical note:
    7017             :         // http://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#qa/qa2004/qa1361.html
    7018             : 
    7019             :         // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
    7020             :         // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
    7021             :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    7022             : 
    7023             :             int                 mib[4];
    7024             :             struct kinfo_proc   info;
    7025             :             std::size_t         size;
    7026             : 
    7027             :             // Initialize the flags so that, if sysctl fails for some bizarre
    7028             :             // reason, we get a predictable result.
    7029             : 
    7030             :             info.kp_proc.p_flag = 0;
    7031             : 
    7032             :             // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl the info we want, in this case
    7033             :             // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
    7034             : 
    7035             :             mib[0] = CTL_KERN;
    7036             :             mib[1] = KERN_PROC;
    7037             :             mib[2] = KERN_PROC_PID;
    7038             :             mib[3] = getpid();
    7039             : 
    7040             :             // Call sysctl.
    7041             : 
    7042             :             size = sizeof(info);
    7043             :             if( sysctl(mib, sizeof(mib) / sizeof(*mib), &info, &size, nullptr, 0) != 0 ) {
    7044             :                 Catch::cerr() << "\n** Call to sysctl failed - unable to determine if debugger is active **\n" << std::endl;
    7045             :                 return false;
    7046             :             }
    7047             : 
    7048             :             // We're being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
    7049             : 
    7050             :             return ( (info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED) != 0 );
    7051             :         }
    7052             :     } // namespace Catch
    7053             : 
    7054             : #elif defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX)
    7055             :     #include <fstream>
    7056             :     #include <string>
    7057             : 
    7058             :     namespace Catch{
    7059             :         // The standard POSIX way of detecting a debugger is to attempt to
    7060             :         // ptrace() the process, but this needs to be done from a child and not
    7061             :         // this process itself to still allow attaching to this process later
    7062             :         // if wanted, so is rather heavy. Under Linux we have the PID of the
    7063             :         // "debugger" (which doesn't need to be gdb, of course, it could also
    7064             :         // be strace, for example) in /proc/$PID/status, so just get it from
    7065             :         // there instead.
    7066           0 :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    7067             :             // Libstdc++ has a bug, where std::ifstream sets errno to 0
    7068             :             // This way our users can properly assert over errno values
    7069           0 :             ErrnoGuard guard;
    7070           0 :             std::ifstream in("/proc/self/status");
    7071           0 :             for( std::string line; std::getline(in, line); ) {
    7072             :                 static const int PREFIX_LEN = 11;
    7073           0 :                 if( line.compare(0, PREFIX_LEN, "TracerPid:\t") == 0 ) {
    7074             :                     // We're traced if the PID is not 0 and no other PID starts
    7075             :                     // with 0 digit, so it's enough to check for just a single
    7076             :                     // character.
    7077           0 :                     return line.length() > PREFIX_LEN && line[PREFIX_LEN] != '0';
    7078             :                 }
    7079             :             }
    7080             : 
    7081           0 :             return false;
    7082             :         }
    7083             :     } // namespace Catch
    7084             : #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
    7085             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    7086             :     namespace Catch {
    7087             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    7088             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    7089             :         }
    7090             :     }
    7091             : #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
    7092             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    7093             :     namespace Catch {
    7094             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    7095             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    7096             :         }
    7097             :     }
    7098             : #else
    7099             :     namespace Catch {
    7100             :        bool isDebuggerActive() { return false; }
    7101             :     }
    7102             : #endif // Platform
    7103             : // end catch_debugger.cpp
    7104             : // start catch_decomposer.cpp
    7105             : 
    7106             : namespace Catch {
    7107             : 
    7108             :     ITransientExpression::~ITransientExpression() = default;
    7109             : 
    7110           0 :     void formatReconstructedExpression( std::ostream &os, std::string const& lhs, StringRef op, std::string const& rhs ) {
    7111           0 :         if( lhs.size() + rhs.size() < 40 &&
    7112           0 :                 lhs.find('\n') == std::string::npos &&
    7113           0 :                 rhs.find('\n') == std::string::npos )
    7114           0 :             os << lhs << " " << op << " " << rhs;
    7115             :         else
    7116           0 :             os << lhs << "\n" << op << "\n" << rhs;
    7117           0 :     }
    7118             : }
    7119             : // end catch_decomposer.cpp

    7162           0 :         m_translators.push_back( std::unique_ptr<const IExceptionTranslator>( translator ) );
    7163           0 :     }
    7164             : 
    7165           0 :     std::string ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::translateActiveException() const {
    7166             :         try {
    7167             : #ifdef __OBJC__
    7168             :             // In Objective-C try objective-c exceptions first
    7169             :             @try {
    7170             :                 return tryTranslators();
    7171             :             }
    7172             :             @catch (NSException *exception) {
    7173             :                 return Catch::Detail::stringify( [exception description] );
    7174             :             }
    7175             : #else
    7176             :             // Compiling a mixed mode project with MSVC means that CLR
    7177             :             // exceptions will be caught in (...) as well. However, these
    7178             :             // do not fill-in std::current_exception and thus lead to crash
    7179             :             // when attempting rethrow.
    7180             :             // /EHa switch also causes structured exceptions to be caught
    7181             :             // here, but they fill-in current_exception properly, so
    7182             :             // at worst the output should be a little weird, instead of
    7183             :             // causing a crash.
    7184           0 :             if (std::current_exception() == nullptr) {
    7185           0 :                 return "Non C++ exception. Possibly a CLR exception.";
    7186             :             }
    7187           0 :             return tryTranslators();
    7188             : #endif
    7189             :         }
    7190           0 :         catch( TestFailureException& ) {
    7191           0 :             std::rethrow_exception(std::current_exception());
    7192             :         }
    7193           0 :         catch( std::exception& ex ) {
    7194           0 :             return ex.what();
    7195             :         }
    7196           0 :         catch( std::string& msg ) {
    7197           0 :             return msg;
    7198             :         }
    7199           0 :         catch( const char* msg ) {
    7200           0 :             return msg;
    7201             :         }
    7202           0 :         catch(...) {
    7203           0 :             return "Unknown exception";
    7204             :         }
    7205             :     }
    7206             : 
    7207           0 :     std::string ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::tryTranslators() const {
    7208           0 :         if( m_translators.empty() )
    7209           0 :             std::rethrow_exception(std::current_exception());
    7210             :         else
    7211           0 :             return m_translators[0]->translate( m_translators.begin()+1, m_translators.end() );
    7212             :     }
    7213             : }

    7222             : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH ) || defined( CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS )
    7223             : 
    7224             : namespace {
    7225             :     // Report the error condition
    7226           0 :     void reportFatal( char const * const message ) {
    7227           0 :         Catch::getCurrentContext().getResultCapture()->handleFatalErrorCondition( message );
    7228           0 :     }
    7229             : }
    7230             : 
    7231             : #endif // signals/SEH handling
    7232             : 
    7233             : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH )
    7234             : 
    7235             : namespace Catch {
    7236             :     struct SignalDefs { DWORD id; const char* name; };
    7237             : 
    7238             :     // There is no 1-1 mapping between signals and windows exceptions.
    7239             :     // Windows can easily distinguish between SO and SigSegV,
    7240             :     // but SigInt, SigTerm, etc are handled differently.
    7241             :     static SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
    7242             :         { EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
    7243             :         { EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW, "SIGSEGV - Stack overflow" },
    7244             :         { EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
    7245             :         { EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO, "Divide by zero error" },
    7246             :     };
    7247             : 
    7248             :     LONG CALLBACK FatalConditionHandler::handleVectoredException(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS ExceptionInfo) {
    7249             :         for (auto const& def : signalDefs) {
    7250             :             if (ExceptionInfo->ExceptionRecord->ExceptionCode == def.id) {
    7251             :                 reportFatal(def.name);
    7252             :             }
    7253             :         }
    7254             :         // If its not an exception we care about, pass it along.
    7255             :         // This stops us from eating debugger breaks etc.
    7256             :         return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
    7257             :     }
    7258             : 
    7259             :     FatalConditionHandler::FatalConditionHandler() {
    7260             :         isSet = true;
    7261             :         // 32k seems enough for Catch to handle stack overflow,
    7262             :         // but the value was found experimentally, so there is no strong guarantee
    7263             :         guaranteeSize = 32 * 1024;
    7264             :         exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
    7265             :         // Register as first handler in current chain
    7266             :         exceptionHandlerHandle = AddVectoredExceptionHandler(1, handleVectoredException);
    7267             :         // Pass in guarantee size to be filled
    7268             :         SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
    7269             :     }
    7270             : 
    7271             :     void FatalConditionHandler::reset() {
    7272             :         if (isSet) {
    7273             :             RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler(exceptionHandlerHandle);
    7274             :             SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
    7275             :             exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
    7276             :             isSet = false;
    7277             :         }
    7278             :     }
    7279             : 
    7280             :     FatalConditionHandler::~FatalConditionHandler() {
    7281             :         reset();
    7282             :     }
    7283             : 
    7284             : bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;
    7285             : ULONG FatalConditionHandler::guaranteeSize = 0;
    7286             : PVOID FatalConditionHandler::exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
    7287             : 
    7288             : } // namespace Catch
    7289             : 
    7290             : #elif defined( CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS )
    7291             : 
    7292             : namespace Catch {
    7293             : 
    7294             :     struct SignalDefs {
    7295             :         int id;
    7296             :         const char* name;
    7297             :     };
    7298             :     static SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
    7299             :         { SIGINT,  "SIGINT - Terminal interrupt signal" },
    7300             :         { SIGILL,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
    7301             :         { SIGFPE,  "SIGFPE - Floating point error signal" },
    7302             :         { SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
    7303             :         { SIGTERM, "SIGTERM - Termination request signal" },
    7304             :         { SIGABRT, "SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal" }
    7305             :     };
    7306             : 
    7307           0 :     void FatalConditionHandler::handleSignal( int sig ) {
    7308           0 :         char const * name = "<unknown signal>";
    7309           0 :         for (auto const& def : signalDefs) {
    7310           0 :             if (sig == def.id) {
    7311           0 :                 name = def.name;
    7312           0 :                 break;
    7313             :             }
    7314             :         }
    7315           0 :         reset();
    7316           0 :         reportFatal(name);
    7317           0 :         raise( sig );
    7318           0 :     }
    7319             : 
    7320           6 :     FatalConditionHandler::FatalConditionHandler() {
    7321           6 :         isSet = true;
    7322             :         stack_t sigStack;
    7323           6 :         sigStack.ss_sp = altStackMem;
    7324           6 :         sigStack.ss_size = SIGSTKSZ;
    7325           6 :         sigStack.ss_flags = 0;
    7326           6 :         sigaltstack(&sigStack, &oldSigStack);
    7327           6 :         struct sigaction sa = { };
    7328             : 
    7329           6 :         sa.sa_handler = handleSignal;
    7330           6 :         sa.sa_flags = SA_ONSTACK;
    7331          42 :         for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
    7332          36 :             sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &sa, &oldSigActions[i]);
    7333             :         }
    7334           6 :     }
    7335             : 
    7336           6 :     FatalConditionHandler::~FatalConditionHandler() {
    7337           6 :         reset();

    7339             : 
    7340          12 :     void FatalConditionHandler::reset() {
    7341          12 :         if( isSet ) {
    7342             :             // Set signals back to previous values -- hopefully nobody overwrote them in the meantime
    7343          42 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i ) {
    7344          36 :                 sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &oldSigActions[i], nullptr);
    7345             :             }
    7346             :             // Return the old stack
    7347           6 :             sigaltstack(&oldSigStack, nullptr);
    7348           6 :             isSet = false;
    7349             :         }
    7350          12 :     }
    7351             :

    7553             :         }
    7554             :         else {

    7645           0 :     std::size_t listTests( Config const& config ) {
    7646           0 :         TestSpec testSpec = config.testSpec();
    7647           0 :         if( config.hasTestFilters() )
    7648           0 :             Catch::cout() << "Matching test cases:\n";
    7649             :         else {
    7650           0 :             Catch::cout() << "All available test cases:\n";
    7651             :         }
    7652             : 
    7653           0 :         auto matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );
    7654           0 :         for( auto const& testCaseInfo : matchedTestCases ) {
    7655           0 :             Colour::Code colour = testCaseInfo.isHidden()
    7656             :                 ? Colour::SecondaryText
    7657           0 :                 : Colour::None;
    7658           0 :             Colour colourGuard( colour );
    7659             : 
    7660           0 :             Catch::cout() << Column( testCaseInfo.name ).initialIndent( 2 ).indent( 4 ) << "\n";
    7661           0 :             if( config.verbosity() >= Verbosity::High ) {
    7662           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Column( Catch::Detail::stringify( testCaseInfo.lineInfo ) ).indent(4) << std::endl;
    7663           0 :                 std::string description = testCaseInfo.description;
    7664           0 :                 if( description.empty() )
    7665           0 :                     description = "(NO DESCRIPTION)";
    7666           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Column( description ).indent(4) << std::endl;
    7667             :             }
    7668           0 :             if( !testCaseInfo.tags.empty() )
    7669           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Column( testCaseInfo.tagsAsString() ).indent( 6 ) << "\n";
    7670             :         }
    7671             : 
    7672           0 :         if( !config.hasTestFilters() )
    7673           0 :             Catch::cout() << pluralise( matchedTestCases.size(), "test case" ) << '\n' << std::endl;
    7674             :         else
    7675           0 :             Catch::cout() << pluralise( matchedTestCases.size(), "matching test case" ) << '\n' << std::endl;
    7676           0 :         return matchedTestCases.size();
    7677             :     }
    7678             : 
    7679           0 :     std::size_t listTestsNamesOnly( Config const& config ) {

    7684           0 :             matchedTests++;

    7692             :         }
    7693           0 :         return matchedTests;
    7694             :     }

    7708           0 :     std::size_t listTags( Config const& config ) {

    7711           0 :             Catch::cout() << "Tags for matching test cases:\n";

    7713           0 :             Catch::cout() << "All available tags:\n";
    7714             :         }
    7715             : 
    7716           0 :         std::map<std::string, TagInfo> tagCounts;
    7717             : 
    7718           0 :         std::vector<TestCase> matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );

    7720           0 :             for( auto const& tagName : testCase.getTestCaseInfo().tags ) {
    7721           0 :                 std::string lcaseTagName = toLower( tagName );
    7722           0 :                 auto countIt = tagCounts.find( lcaseTagName );
    7723           0 :                 if( countIt == tagCounts.end() )
    7724           0 :                     countIt = tagCounts.insert( std::make_pair( lcaseTagName, TagInfo() ) ).first;
    7725           0 :                 countIt->second.add( tagName );
    7726             :             }
    7727             :         }
    7728             :

    7734           0 :                                                     .initialIndent( 0 )
    7735           0 :                                                     .indent( str.size() )

    7737           0 :             Catch::cout() << str << wrapper << '\n';
    7738             :         }
    7739           0 :         Catch::cout() << pluralise( tagCounts.size(), "tag" ) << '\n' << std::endl;

    7822             : template <typename T>
    7823             : struct Converter;
    7824             : 
    7825             : template <>
    7826             : struct Converter<float> {
    7827             :     static_assert(sizeof(float) == sizeof(int32_t), "Important ULP matcher assumption violated");
    7828           0 :     Converter(float f) {
    7829           0 :         std::memcpy(&i, &f, sizeof(f));
    7830           0 :     }
    7831             :     int32_t i;
    7832             : };
    7833             : 
    7834             : template <>
    7835             : struct Converter<double> {
    7836             :     static_assert(sizeof(double) == sizeof(int64_t), "Important ULP matcher assumption violated");
    7837           0 :     Converter(double d) {
    7838           0 :         std::memcpy(&i, &d, sizeof(d));
    7839           0 :     }
    7840             :     int64_t i;
    7841             : };
    7842             : 
    7843             : template <typename T>
    7844           0 : auto convert(T t) -> Converter<T> {
    7845           0 :     return Converter<T>(t);
    7846             : }
    7847             : 
    7848             : template <typename FP>
    7849           0 : bool almostEqualUlps(FP lhs, FP rhs, int maxUlpDiff) {
    7850             :     // Comparison with NaN should always be false.
    7851             :     // This way we can rule it out before getting into the ugly details
    7852           0 :     if (std::isnan(lhs) || std::isnan(rhs)) {
    7853           0 :         return false;
    7854             :     }
    7855             : 
    7856           0 :     auto lc = convert(lhs);
    7857           0 :     auto rc = convert(rhs);
    7858             : 
    7859           0 :     if ((lc.i < 0) != (rc.i < 0)) {
    7860             :         // Potentially we can have +0 and -0
    7861           0 :         return lhs == rhs;
    7862             :     }
    7863             : 
    7864           0 :     auto ulpDiff = std::abs(lc.i - rc.i);
    7865           0 :     return ulpDiff <= maxUlpDiff;
    7866             : }
    7867             : 
    7868             : }
    7869             : 
    7870             : namespace Catch {
    7871             : namespace Matchers {
    7872             : namespace Floating {
    7873           0 :     WithinAbsMatcher::WithinAbsMatcher(double target, double margin)
    7874           0 :         :m_target{ target }, m_margin{ margin } {
    7875           0 :         if (m_margin < 0) {
    7876           0 :             throw std::domain_error("Allowed margin difference has to be >= 0");
    7877             :         }
    7878           0 :     }
    7879             : 
    7880             :     // Performs equivalent check of std::fabs(lhs - rhs) <= margin
    7881             :     // But without the subtraction to allow for INFINITY in comparison
    7882           0 :     bool WithinAbsMatcher::match(double const& matchee) const {
    7883           0 :         return (matchee + m_margin >= m_target) && (m_target + m_margin >= m_margin);
    7884             :     }
    7885             : 
    7886           0 :     std::string WithinAbsMatcher::describe() const {
    7887           0 :         return "is within " + ::Catch::Detail::stringify(m_margin) + " of " + ::Catch::Detail::stringify(m_target);
    7888             :     }
    7889             : 
    7890           0 :     WithinUlpsMatcher::WithinUlpsMatcher(double target, int ulps, FloatingPointKind baseType)

    7892           0 :         if (m_ulps < 0) {
    7893           0 :             throw std::domain_error("Allowed ulp difference has to be >= 0");
    7894             :         }
    7895           0 :     }
    7896             : 
    7897           0 :     bool WithinUlpsMatcher::match(double const& matchee) const {
    7898           0 :         switch (m_type) {
    7899             :         case FloatingPointKind::Float:
    7900           0 :             return almostEqualUlps<float>(static_cast<float>(matchee), static_cast<float>(m_target), m_ulps);
    7901             :         case FloatingPointKind::Double:
    7902           0 :             return almostEqualUlps<double>(matchee, m_target, m_ulps);
    7903             :         default:
    7904           0 :             throw std::domain_error("Unknown FloatingPointKind value");
    7905             :         }
    7906             :     }
    7907             :

    7941           0 :             m_str( adjustString( str ) )
    7942           0 :         {}
    7943           0 :         std::string CasedString::adjustString( std::string const& str ) const {
    7944           0 :             return m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::No
    7945             :                    ? toLower( str )
    7946           0 :                    : str;
    7947             :         }
    7948           0 :         std::string CasedString::caseSensitivitySuffix() const {
    7949           0 :             return m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::No
    7950             :                    ? " (case insensitive)"
    7951           0 :                    : std::string();
    7952             :         }

    7962           0 :                                         m_comparator.caseSensitivitySuffix().size());
    7963           0 :             description += m_operation;
    7964           0 :             description += ": \"";
    7965           0 :             description += m_comparator.m_str;
    7966           0 :             description += "\"";
    7967           0 :             description += m_comparator.caseSensitivitySuffix();
    7968           0 :             return description;
    7969             :         }

    7975             :         }
    7976             :

    7982             :

    8480             : 
    8481           2 :     Totals RunContext::runTest(TestCase const& testCase) {
    8482           2 :         Totals prevTotals = m_totals;
    8483             : 
    8484           4 :         std::string redirectedCout;
    8485           4 :         std::string redirectedCerr;
    8486             : 
    8487           2 :         auto const& testInfo = testCase.getTestCaseInfo();
    8488             : 
    8489           2 :         m_reporter->testCaseStarting(testInfo);
    8490             : 
    8491           2 :         m_activeTestCase = &testCase;
    8492             : 
    8493           2 :         ITracker& rootTracker = m_trackerContext.startRun();
    8494           2 :         assert(rootTracker.isSectionTracker());
    8495           2 :         static_cast<SectionTracker&>(rootTracker).addInitialFilters(m_config->getSectionsToRun());
    8496           6 :         do {
    8497           6 :             m_trackerContext.startCycle();
    8498           6 :             m_testCaseTracker = &SectionTracker::acquire(m_trackerContext, TestCaseTracking::NameAndLocation(testInfo.name, testInfo.lineInfo));
    8499           6 :             runCurrentTest(redirectedCout, redirectedCerr);
    8500           6 :         } while (!m_testCaseTracker->isSuccessfullyCompleted() && !aborting());
    8501             : 
    8502           2 :         Totals deltaTotals = m_totals.delta(prevTotals);
    8503           2 :         if (testInfo.expectedToFail() && deltaTotals.testCases.passed > 0) {
    8504           0 :             deltaTotals.assertions.failed++;
    8505           0 :             deltaTotals.testCases.passed--;
    8506           0 :             deltaTotals.testCases.failed++;
    8507             :         }
    8508           2 :         m_totals.testCases += deltaTotals.testCases;
    8509           6 :         m_reporter->testCaseEnded(TestCaseStats(testInfo,
    8510             :                                   deltaTotals,
    8511             :                                   redirectedCout,
    8512             :                                   redirectedCerr,
    8513           4 :                                   aborting()));
    8514             : 
    8515           2 :         m_activeTestCase = nullptr;
    8516           2 :         m_testCaseTracker = nullptr;
    8517             : 
    8518           4 :         return deltaTotals;

    8529           0 :     void RunContext::assertionEnded(AssertionResult const & result) {

    8531           0 :             m_totals.assertions.passed++;

    8534           0 :             m_lastAssertionPassed = false;
    8535           0 :             if( m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo().okToFail() )
    8536           0 :                 m_totals.assertions.failedButOk++;
    8537             :             else
    8538           0 :                 m_totals.assertions.failed++;
    8539             :         }
    8540             :         else {
    8541           0 :             m_lastAssertionPassed = true;
    8542             :         }

    8544             :         // We have no use for the return value (whether messages should be cleared), because messages were made scoped
    8545             :         // and should be let to clear themselves out.
    8546           0 :         static_cast<void>(m_reporter->assertionEnded(AssertionStats(result, m_messages, m_totals)));
    8547             : 
    8548             :         // Reset working state
    8549           0 :         resetAssertionInfo();
    8550           0 :         m_lastResult = result;
    8551           0 :     }

    8687           6 :     void RunContext::runCurrentTest(std::string & redirectedCout, std::string & redirectedCerr) {
    8688           6 :         auto const& testCaseInfo = m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo();

    8693           6 :         m_shouldReportUnexpected = true;
    8694           6 :         m_lastAssertionInfo = { "TEST_CASE"_sr, testCaseInfo.lineInfo, StringRef(), ResultDisposition::Normal };
    8695             :

    8697             : 
    8698           6 :         Timer timer;

    8700           6 :             if (m_reporter->getPreferences().shouldRedirectStdOut) {
    8701           0 :                 RedirectedStdOut redirectedStdOut;
    8702           0 :                 RedirectedStdErr redirectedStdErr;
    8703           0 :                 timer.start();

    8705           0 :                 redirectedCout += redirectedStdOut.str();
    8706           0 :                 redirectedCerr += redirectedStdErr.str();
    8707             : 
    8708             :             } else {
    8709           6 :                 timer.start();
    8710           6 :                 invokeActiveTestCase();
    8711             :             }
    8712           6 :             duration = timer.getElapsedSeconds();
    8713           0 :         } catch (TestFailureException&) {
    8714             :             // This just means the test was aborted due to failure
    8715           0 :         } catch (...) {
    8716             :             // Under CATCH_CONFIG_FAST_COMPILE, unexpected exceptions under REQUIRE assertions
    8717             :             // are reported without translation at the point of origin.

    9015             :

    9017             :

    9019           1 :             auto const& listeners = Catch::getRegistryHub().getReporterRegistry().getListeners();

    9021           0 :                 addReporter(reporters, listener->create(Catch::ReporterConfig(config)));
    9022           1 :         }
    9023             : 
    9024           1 :         Catch::Totals runTests(std::shared_ptr<Config> const& config) {
    9025           2 :             IStreamingReporterPtr reporter = makeReporter(config);
    9026           1 :             addListeners(reporter, config);
    9027             : 
    9028           2 :             RunContext context(config, std::move(reporter));
    9029             : 
    9030           1 :             Totals totals;
    9031             : 
    9032           1 :             context.testGroupStarting(config->name(), 1, 1);
    9033             : 
    9034           2 :             TestSpec testSpec = config->testSpec();
    9035             : 
    9036           1 :             auto const& allTestCases = getAllTestCasesSorted(*config);
    9037           3 :             for (auto const& testCase : allTestCases) {
    9038           2 :                 if (!context.aborting() && matchTest(testCase, testSpec, *config))
    9039           2 :                     totals += context.runTest(testCase);
    9040             :                 else
    9041           0 :                     context.reporter().skipTest(testCase);

    9239             :             // the return value to 255 prevents false negative when some multiple
    9240             :             // of 256 tests has failed

    9300           0 :                 StreamBufImpl::sync();

    9304           0 :             int overflow( int c ) override {
    9305           0 :                 sync();

    9307           0 :                 if( c != EOF ) {
    9308           0 :                     if( pbase() == epptr() )
    9309           0 :                         m_writer( std::string( 1, static_cast<char>( c ) ) );
    9310             :                     else

    9312             :                 }
    9313           0 :                 return 0;
    9314             :             }
    9315             : 
    9316           0 :             int sync() override {
    9317           0 :                 if( pbase() != pptr() ) {
    9318           0 :                     m_writer( std::string( pbase(), static_cast<std::string::size_type>( pptr() - pbase() ) ) );

    9320             :                 }
    9321           0 :                 return 0;
    9322             :             }

    9503           0 :     std::string trim( std::string const& str ) {
    9504             :         static char const* whitespaceChars = "\n\r\t ";
    9505           0 :         std::string::size_type start = str.find_first_not_of( whitespaceChars );
    9506           0 :         std::string::size_type end = str.find_last_not_of( whitespaceChars );
    9507             : 
    9508           0 :         return start != std::string::npos ? str.substr( start, 1+end-start ) : std::string();
    9509             :     }
    9510             : 
    9511           0 :     bool replaceInPlace( std::string& str, std::string const& replaceThis, std::string const& withThis ) {
    9512           0 :         bool replaced = false;
    9513           0 :         std::size_t i = str.find( replaceThis );
    9514           0 :         while( i != std::string::npos ) {
    9515           0 :             replaced = true;
    9516           0 :             str = str.substr( 0, i ) + withThis + str.substr( i+replaceThis.size() );
    9517           0 :             if( i < str.size()-withThis.size() )
    9518           0 :                 i = str.find( replaceThis, i+withThis.size() );
    9519             :             else
    9520           0 :                 i = std::string::npos;
    9521             :         }
    9522           0 :         return replaced;
    9523             :     }

    9614           0 :     auto StringRef::numberOfCharacters() const noexcept -> size_type {
    9615           0 :         size_type noChars = m_size;

    9617           0 :         for( size_type i=0; i < m_size; ++i ) {
    9618           0 :             char c = m_start[i];
    9619           0 :             if( ( c & byte_2_lead ) == byte_2_lead ) {
    9620           0 :                 noChars--;
    9621           0 :                 if (( c & byte_3_lead ) == byte_3_lead )
    9622           0 :                     noChars--;
    9623           0 :                 if( ( c & byte_4_lead ) == byte_4_lead )
    9624           0 :                     noChars--;
    9625             :             }
    9626             :         }
    9627           0 :         return noChars;
    9628             :     }

    9736           0 :     TestCaseInfo::SpecialProperties parseSpecialTag( std::string const& tag ) {
    9737           0 :         if( startsWith( tag, '.' ) ||
    9738           0 :             tag == "!hide" )
    9739           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::IsHidden;
    9740           0 :         else if( tag == "!throws" )
    9741           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::Throws;
    9742           0 :         else if( tag == "!shouldfail" )
    9743           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::ShouldFail;
    9744           0 :         else if( tag == "!mayfail" )
    9745           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::MayFail;
    9746           0 :         else if( tag == "!nonportable" )
    9747           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::NonPortable;
    9748           0 :         else if( tag == "!benchmark" )
    9749           0 :             return static_cast<TestCaseInfo::SpecialProperties>( TestCaseInfo::Benchmark | TestCaseInfo::IsHidden );
    9750             :         else
    9751           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::None;
    9752             :     }
    9753           0 :     bool isReservedTag( std::string const& tag ) {
    9754           0 :         return parseSpecialTag( tag ) == TestCaseInfo::None && tag.size() > 0 && !std::isalnum( tag[0] );
    9755             :     }

    9898           1 :     std::vector<TestCase> sortTests( IConfig const& config, std::vector<TestCase> const& unsortedTestCases ) {
    9899             : 
    9900           1 :         std::vector<TestCase> sorted = unsortedTestCases;
    9901             :

    9904           0 :                 std::sort( sorted.begin(), sorted.end() );
    9905           0 :                 break;
    9906             :             case RunTests::InRandomOrder:
    9907           0 :                 seedRng( config );
    9908           0 :                 RandomNumberGenerator::shuffle( sorted );
    9909           0 :                 break;
    9910             :             case RunTests::InDeclarationOrder:
    9911             :                 // already in declaration order
    9912           1 :                 break;
    9913             :         }
    9914           1 :         return sorted;
    9915             :     }
    9916           2 :     bool matchTest( TestCase const& testCase, TestSpec const& testSpec, IConfig const& config ) {
    9917           2 :         return testSpec.matches( testCase ) && ( config.allowThrows() || !testCase.throws() );

    9923           2 :             auto prev = seenFunctions.insert( function );

    9925             :                     "error: TEST_CASE( \"" << function.name << "\" ) already defined.\n"
    9926             :                     << "\tFirst seen at " << prev.first->getTestCaseInfo().lineInfo << "\n"
    9927             :                     << "\tRedefined at " << function.getTestCaseInfo().lineInfo );
    9928             :         }
    9929           1 :     }

    9932           0 :         std::vector<TestCase> filtered;

    9935           0 :             if( matchTest( testCase, testSpec, config ) )
    9936           0 :                 filtered.push_back( testCase );

   10366           3 :     void TestSpecParser::visitChar( char c ) {

   10368           2 :             switch( c ) {
   10369           0 :             case ' ': return;
   10370           1 :             case '~': m_exclusion = true; return;

   10375             :             }
   10376             :         }
