   10430          42 :     auto getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch() -> uint64_t {
   10431          42 :         return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::nanoseconds>( std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now().time_since_epoch() ).count();
   10432             :     }
   10433             : 
   10434           0 :     auto estimateClockResolution() -> uint64_t {
   10435           0 :         uint64_t sum = 0;
   10436             :         static const uint64_t iterations = 1000000;
   10437             : 
   10438           0 :         for( std::size_t i = 0; i < iterations; ++i ) {
   10439             : 
   10440             :             uint64_t ticks;
   10441           0 :             uint64_t baseTicks = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   10442           0 :             do {
   10443           0 :                 ticks = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   10444             :             }
   10445           0 :             while( ticks == baseTicks );
   10446             : 
   10447           0 :             auto delta = ticks - baseTicks;
   10448           0 :             sum += delta;
   10449             :         }
   10450             : 
   10451             :         // We're just taking the mean, here. To do better we could take the std. dev and exclude outliers
   10452             :         // - and potentially do more iterations if there's a high variance.
   10453           0 :         return sum/iterations;
   10454             :     }
   10455           0 :     auto getEstimatedClockResolution() -> uint64_t {
   10456           0 :         static auto s_resolution = estimateClockResolution();
   10457           0 :         return s_resolution;
   10458             :     }
   10459             : 
   10460          31 :     void Timer::start() {
   10461          31 :        m_nanoseconds = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   10462          31 :     }

   10465             :     }

   10502             : 
   10503             :         struct Endianness {
   10504             :             enum Arch { Big, Little };
   10505             : 
   10506           0 :             static Arch which() {
   10507             :                 union _{
   10508             :                     int asInt;
   10509             :                     char asChar[sizeof (int)];
   10510             :                 } u;
   10511             : 
   10512           0 :                 u.asInt = 1;
   10513           0 :                 return ( u.asChar[sizeof(int)-1] == 1 ) ? Big : Little;
   10514             :             }
   10515             :         };
   10516             :     }
   10517             : 
   10518           0 :     std::string rawMemoryToString( const void *object, std::size_t size ) {
   10519             :         // Reverse order for little endian architectures
   10520           0 :         int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>( size ), inc = 1;
   10521           0 :         if( Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little ) {
   10522           0 :             i = end-1;
   10523           0 :             end = inc = -1;
   10524             :         }
   10525             : 
   10526           0 :         unsigned char const *bytes = static_cast<unsigned char const *>(object);
   10527           0 :         ReusableStringStream rss;
   10528           0 :         rss << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
   10529           0 :         for( ; i != end; i += inc )
   10530           0 :              rss << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
   10531           0 :        return rss.str();
   10532             :     }
   10533             : }
   10534             : 
   10535             : template<typename T>
   10536           0 : std::string fpToString( T value, int precision ) {
   10537           0 :     if (std::isnan(value)) {
   10538           0 :         return "nan";
   10539             :     }
   10540             : 
   10541           0 :     ReusableStringStream rss;
   10542           0 :     rss << std::setprecision( precision )
   10543           0 :         << std::fixed
   10544             :         << value;
   10545           0 :     std::string d = rss.str();
   10546           0 :     std::size_t i = d.find_last_not_of( '0' );
   10547           0 :     if( i != std::string::npos && i != d.size()-1 ) {
   10548           0 :         if( d[i] == '.' )
   10549           0 :             i++;
   10550           0 :         d = d.substr( 0, i+1 );
   10551             :     }
   10552           0 :     return d;
   10553             : }
   10554             : 
   10555             : //// ======================================================= ////
   10556             : //

   10558             : //
   10559             : //// ======================================================= ////
   10560             : 
   10561           0 : std::string StringMaker<std::string>::convert(const std::string& str) {
   10562           0 :     if (!getCurrentContext().getConfig()->showInvisibles()) {
   10563           0 :         return '"' + str + '"';
   10564             :     }
   10565             : 
   10566           0 :     std::string s("\"");
   10567           0 :     for (char c : str) {
   10568           0 :         switch (c) {
   10569             :         case '\n':
   10570           0 :             s.append("\\n");
   10571           0 :             break;

   10577           0 :             break;

   10832           0 :             m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 0, m_pattern.size()-1 );

   10834             :         }
   10835           0 :     }
   10836             : 
   10837           0 :     bool WildcardPattern::matches( std::string const& str ) const {
   10838           0 :         switch( m_wildcard ) {
   10839             :             case NoWildcard:
   10840           0 :                 return m_pattern == adjustCase( str );
   10841             :             case WildcardAtStart:
   10842           0 :                 return endsWith( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
   10843             :             case WildcardAtEnd:
   10844           0 :                 return startsWith( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
   10845             :             case WildcardAtBothEnds:
   10846           0 :                 return contains( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
   10847             :             default:
   10848           0 :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown enum" );
   10849             :         }
   10850             :     }
   10851             : 
   10852           0 :     std::string WildcardPattern::adjustCase( std::string const& str ) const {
   10853           0 :         return m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::No ? toLower( str ) : str;
   10854             :     }
   10855             : }

   10863           0 :     XmlEncode::XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat )
   10864             :     :   m_str( str ),
   10865           0 :         m_forWhat( forWhat )
   10866           0 :     {}
   10867             : 
   10868           0 :     void XmlEncode::encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
   10869             : 
   10870             :         // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
   10871             :         // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
   10872             : 
   10873           0 :         for( std::size_t i = 0; i < m_str.size(); ++ i ) {
   10874           0 :             char c = m_str[i];
   10875           0 :             switch( c ) {
   10876           0 :                 case '<':   os << "&lt;"; break;
   10877           0 :                 case '&':   os << "&amp;"; break;
   10878             : 
   10879             :                 case '>':
   10880             :                     // See: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
   10881           0 :                     if( i > 2 && m_str[i-1] == ']' && m_str[i-2] == ']' )
   10882           0 :                         os << "&gt;";
   10883             :                     else
   10884           0 :                         os << c;
   10885           0 :                     break;
   10886             : 
   10887             :                 case '\"':
   10888           0 :                     if( m_forWhat == ForAttributes )
   10889           0 :                         os << "&quot;";
   10890             :                     else
   10891           0 :                         os << c;
   10892           0 :                     break;
   10893             : 
   10894             :                 default:
   10895             :                     // Escape control chars - based on contribution by @espenalb in PR #465 and
   10896             :                     // by @mrpi PR #588
   10897           0 :                     if ( ( c >= 0 && c < '\x09' ) || ( c > '\x0D' && c < '\x20') || c=='\x7F' ) {
   10898             :                         // see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
   10899           0 :                         os << "\\x" << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
   10900           0 :                            << static_cast<int>( c );
   10901             :                     }
   10902             :                     else
   10903           0 :                         os << c;
   10904             :             }
   10905             :         }
   10906           0 :     }
   10907             : 
   10908           0 :     std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
   10909           0 :         xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
   10910           0 :         return os;
   10911             :     }

   10971           0 :             m_tagIsOpen = false;
   10972             :         }

   11000             :         }

   11053             :     // Because formatting using c++ streams is stateful, drop down to C is required
   11054             :     // Alternatively we could use stringstream, but its performance is... not good.
   11055           0 :     std::string getFormattedDuration( double duration ) {
   11056             :         // Max exponent + 1 is required to represent the whole part
   11057             :         // + 1 for decimal point
   11058             :         // + 3 for the 3 decimal places
   11059             :         // + 1 for null terminator
   11060           0 :         const std::size_t maxDoubleSize = DBL_MAX_10_EXP + 1 + 1 + 3 + 1;
   11061             :         char buffer[maxDoubleSize];
   11062             : 
   11063             :         // Save previous errno, to prevent sprintf from overwriting it
   11064           0 :         ErrnoGuard guard;
   11065             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   11066             :         sprintf_s(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   11067             : #else
   11068           0 :         sprintf(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   11069             : #endif
   11070           0 :         return std::string(buffer);
   11071             :     }

   11097           0 :     Catch::Colour::Code dimColour() { return Catch::Colour::FileName; }

   11099           0 :     std::string bothOrAll( std::size_t count ) {
   11100             :         return count == 1 ? std::string() :
   11101           0 :                count == 2 ? "both " : "all " ;
   11102             :     }

   11106             : namespace Catch {
   11107             : namespace {
   11108             : // Colour, message variants:
   11109             : // - white: No tests ran.
   11110             : // -   red: Failed [both/all] N test cases, failed [both/all] M assertions.
   11111             : // - white: Passed [both/all] N test cases (no assertions).
   11112             : // -   red: Failed N tests cases, failed M assertions.
   11113             : // - green: Passed [both/all] N tests cases with M assertions.
   11114           0 : void printTotals(std::ostream& out, const Totals& totals) {
   11115           0 :     if (totals.testCases.total() == 0) {
   11116           0 :         out << "No tests ran.";
   11117           0 :     } else if (totals.testCases.failed == totals.testCases.total()) {
   11118           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultError);
   11119             :         const std::string qualify_assertions_failed =
   11120           0 :             totals.assertions.failed == totals.assertions.total() ?
   11121           0 :             bothOrAll(totals.assertions.failed) : std::string();
   11122             :         out <<
   11123           0 :             "Failed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.failed)
   11124           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.failed, "test case") << ", "
   11125           0 :             "failed " << qualify_assertions_failed <<
   11126           0 :             pluralise(totals.assertions.failed, "assertion") << '.';
   11127           0 :     } else if (totals.assertions.total() == 0) {
   11128             :         out <<
   11129           0 :             "Passed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.total())
   11130           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.total(), "test case")
   11131           0 :             << " (no assertions).";
   11132           0 :     } else if (totals.assertions.failed) {
   11133           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultError);
   11134             :         out <<
   11135           0 :             "Failed " << pluralise(totals.testCases.failed, "test case") << ", "
   11136           0 :             "failed " << pluralise(totals.assertions.failed, "assertion") << '.';
   11137             :     } else {
   11138           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultSuccess);
   11139             :         out <<
   11140           0 :             "Passed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.passed)
   11141           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.passed, "test case") <<
   11142           0 :             " with " << pluralise(totals.assertions.passed, "assertion") << '.';

   11146             : // Implementation of CompactReporter formatting
   11147           0 : class AssertionPrinter {
   11148             : public:
   11149             :     AssertionPrinter& operator= (AssertionPrinter const&) = delete;

   11157             : 
   11158           0 :     void print() {
   11159           0 :         printSourceInfo();
   11160             : 
   11161           0 :         itMessage = messages.begin();
   11162             : 
   11163           0 :         switch (result.getResultType()) {
   11164             :         case ResultWas::Ok:
   11165           0 :             printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, passedString());
   11166           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   11167           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   11168           0 :             if (!result.hasExpression())
   11169           0 :                 printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
   11170             :             else
   11171           0 :                 printRemainingMessages();
   11172           0 :             break;
   11173             :         case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   11174           0 :             if (result.isOk())
   11175           0 :                 printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, failedString() + std::string(" - but was ok"));
   11176             :             else
   11177           0 :                 printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   11178           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   11179           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   11180           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   11181           0 :             break;
   11182             :         case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   11183           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   11184           0 :             printIssue("unexpected exception with message:");
   11185           0 :             printMessage();
   11186           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   11187           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   11188           0 :             break;
   11189             :         case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   11190           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());

   11192           0 :             printMessage();
   11193           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   11194           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   11195           0 :             break;
   11196             :         case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   11197           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());

   11199           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   11200           0 :             printRemainingMessages();

   11203           0 :             printResultType(Colour::None, "info");
   11204           0 :             printMessage();

   11206           0 :             break;
   11207             :         case ResultWas::Warning:

   11211           0 :             break;

   11215           0 :             printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
   11216           0 :             break;

   11218             :         case ResultWas::Unknown:
   11219             :         case ResultWas::FailureBit:

   11221           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, "** internal error **");

   11273           0 :     void printMessage() {

   11481           0 :             stream << passOrFail << ":\n";

   11484           0 :     void printOriginalExpression() const {

   11487           0 :             stream << "  ";
   11488           0 :             stream << result.getExpressionInMacro();
   11489           0 :             stream << '\n';
   11490             :         }
   11491           0 :     }

   11494           0 :             stream << "with expansion:\n";

   11496           0 :             stream << Column(result.getExpandedExpression()).indent(2) << '\n';

   11524           3 : std::size_t makeRatio(std::size_t number, std::size_t total) {
   11525           3 :     std::size_t ratio = total > 0 ? CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH * number / total : 0;
   11526           3 :     return (ratio == 0 && number > 0) ? 1 : ratio;

   11528             : 
   11529           1 : std::size_t& findMax(std::size_t& i, std::size_t& j, std::size_t& k) {

   11531           0 :         return i;
   11532           1 :     else if (j > k)

   11538          12 : struct ColumnInfo {
   11539             :     enum Justification { Left, Right };
   11540             :     std::string name;

   11544             : struct ColumnBreak {};

   11546             : 
   11547             : class Duration {
   11548             :     enum class Unit {
   11549             :         Auto,
   11550             :         Nanoseconds,
   11551             :         Microseconds,
   11552             :         Milliseconds,
   11553             :         Seconds,
   11554             :         Minutes
   11555             :     };
   11556             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond = 1000;
   11557             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond;
   11558             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInASecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond;
   11559             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMinute = 60 * s_nanosecondsInASecond;
   11560             : 
   11561             :     uint64_t m_inNanoseconds;
   11562             :     Unit m_units;
   11563             : 
   11564             : public:
   11565           0 :     explicit Duration(uint64_t inNanoseconds, Unit units = Unit::Auto)
   11566             :         : m_inNanoseconds(inNanoseconds),
   11567           0 :         m_units(units) {
   11568           0 :         if (m_units == Unit::Auto) {
   11569           0 :             if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond)
   11570           0 :                 m_units = Unit::Nanoseconds;
   11571           0 :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond)
   11572           0 :                 m_units = Unit::Microseconds;
   11573           0 :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInASecond)
   11574           0 :                 m_units = Unit::Milliseconds;
   11575           0 :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMinute)
   11576           0 :                 m_units = Unit::Seconds;
   11577             :             else
   11578           0 :                 m_units = Unit::Minutes;
   11579             :         }
   11580             : 
   11581           0 :     }
   11582             : 
   11583           0 :     auto value() const -> double {
   11584           0 :         switch (m_units) {
   11585             :         case Unit::Microseconds:
   11586           0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond);
   11587             :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
   11588           0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond);
   11589             :         case Unit::Seconds:
   11590           0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInASecond);
   11591             :         case Unit::Minutes:
   11592           0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMinute);
   11593             :         default:
   11594           0 :             return static_cast<double>(m_inNanoseconds);
   11595             :         }
   11596             :     }
   11597           0 :     auto unitsAsString() const -> std::string {
   11598           0 :         switch (m_units) {
   11599             :         case Unit::Nanoseconds:
   11600           0 :             return "ns";
   11601             :         case Unit::Microseconds:
   11602           0 :             return "s";
   11603             :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
   11604           0 :             return "ms";
   11605             :         case Unit::Seconds:
   11606           0 :             return "s";
   11607             :         case Unit::Minutes:
   11608           0 :             return "m";
   11609             :         default:
   11610           0 :             return "** internal error **";
   11611             :         }
   11612             : 
   11613             :     }
   11614           0 :     friend auto operator << (std::ostream& os, Duration const& duration) -> std::ostream& {

   11892           0 :                 oldRow = ' ' + oldRow;

   11895             :         }

   11906           1 : void ConsoleReporter::printTotals( Totals const& totals ) {

   11912           3 :             << pluralise(totals.assertions.passed, "assertion") << " in "
   11913           3 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.passed, "test case") << ')'
   11914           1 :             << '\n';

   11916             : 
   11917           0 :         std::vector<SummaryColumn> columns;

   11945           0 :             stream << Colour(Colour::LightGrey) << " | ";

   11953           1 : void ConsoleReporter::printTotalsDivider(Totals const& totals) {
   11954           1 :     if (totals.testCases.total() > 0) {
   11955           1 :         std::size_t failedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failed, totals.testCases.total());
   11956           1 :         std::size_t failedButOkRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failedButOk, totals.testCases.total());
   11957           1 :         std::size_t passedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.passed, totals.testCases.total());
   11958           1 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
   11959           0 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio)++;
   11960           3 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio > CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
   11961           1 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio)--;
   11962             : 
   11963           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Error) << std::string(failedRatio, '=');
   11964           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::ResultExpectedFailure) << std::string(failedButOkRatio, '=');
   11965           1 :         if (totals.testCases.allPassed())
   11966           1 :             stream << Colour(Colour::ResultSuccess) << std::string(passedRatio, '=');
   11967             :         else
   11968           0 :             stream << Colour(Colour::Success) << std::string(passedRatio, '=');
   11969             :     } else {
   11970           0 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << std::string(CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1, '=');
   11971             :     }
   11972           1 :     stream << '\n';
   11973           1 : }

   12108           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeTestCase( TestCaseNode const& testCaseNode ) {

   12170           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeAssertion( AssertionStats const& stats ) {
   12171           0 :         AssertionResult const& result = stats.assertionResult;
   12172           0 :         if( !result.isOk() ) {
   12173           0 :             std::string elementName;
   12174           0 :             switch( result.getResultType() ) {
   12175             :                 case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   12176             :                 case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   12177           0 :                     elementName = "error";
   12178           0 :                     break;
   12179             :                 case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   12180           0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   12181           0 :                     break;
   12182             :                 case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   12183           0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   12184           0 :                     break;
   12185             :                 case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   12186           0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   12187           0 :                     break;
   12188             : 
   12189             :                 // We should never see these here:
   12190             :                 case ResultWas::Info:
   12191             :                 case ResultWas::Warning:
   12192             :                 case ResultWas::Ok:
   12193             :                 case ResultWas::Unknown:
   12194             :                 case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   12195             :                 case ResultWas::Exception:
   12196           0 :                     elementName = "internalError";
   12197           0 :                     break;
   12198             :             }
   12199             : 
   12200           0 :             XmlWriter::ScopedElement e = xml.scopedElement( elementName );
   12201             : 
   12202           0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "message", result.getExpandedExpression() );
   12203           0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "type", result.getTestMacroName() );
   12204             :

   12206           0 :             if( !result.getMessage().empty() )
   12207           0 :                 rss << result.getMessage() << '\n';
   12208           0 :             for( auto const& msg : stats.infoMessages )
   12209           0 :                 if( msg.type == ResultWas::Info )
   12210           0 :                     rss << msg.message << '\n';
   12211             : 
   12212           0 :             rss << "at " << result.getSourceInfo();
   12213           0 :             xml.writeText( rss.str(), false );
   12214             :         }
   12215           0 :     }

   12395           0 :     bool XmlReporter::assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) {
   12396             : 
   12397           0 :         AssertionResult const& result = assertionStats.assertionResult;
   12398             : 
   12399           0 :         bool includeResults = m_config->includeSuccessfulResults() || !result.isOk();
   12400             : 
   12401           0 :         if( includeResults || result.getResultType() == ResultWas::Warning ) {
   12402             :             // Print any info messages in <Info> tags.
   12403           0 :             for( auto const& msg : assertionStats.infoMessages ) {
   12404           0 :                 if( msg.type == ResultWas::Info && includeResults ) {
   12405           0 :                     m_xml.scopedElement( "Info" )
   12406           0 :                             .writeText( msg.message );
   12407           0 :                 } else if ( msg.type == ResultWas::Warning ) {
   12408           0 :                     m_xml.scopedElement( "Warning" )
   12409           0 :                             .writeText( msg.message );
   12410             :                 }
   12411             :             }
   12412             :         }
   12413             : 
   12414             :         // Drop out if result was successful but we're not printing them.
   12415           0 :         if( !includeResults && result.getResultType() != ResultWas::Warning )
   12416           0 :             return true;
   12417             : 
   12418             :         // Print the expression if there is one.
   12419           0 :         if( result.hasExpression() ) {
   12420           0 :             m_xml.startElement( "Expression" )

   12422           0 :                 .writeAttribute( "type", result.getTestMacroName() );

   12431             :

   12435           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Exception" );

   12438           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();

   12444           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();
   12445           0 :                 break;
   12446             :             case ResultWas::Info:
   12447           0 :                 m_xml.scopedElement( "Info" )
   12448           0 :                     .writeText( result.getMessage() );
   12449           0 :                 break;
   12450             :             case ResultWas::Warning:
   12451             :                 // Warning will already have been written
   12452           0 :                 break;

   12454           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Failure" );
   12455           0 :                 writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   12456           0 :                 m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   12457           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();

   12550             : #endif

   12561             : #endif
   12562             :

   12578             : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_IMPL_ONLY)
   12579             : 
   12580             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_MAIN_NOT_DEFINED
   12581             : #  undef CLARA_CONFIG_MAIN
   12582             : #endif
   12583             : 
   12584             : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
   12585             : //////
   12586             : // If this config identifier is defined then all CATCH macros are prefixed with CATCH_
   12587             : #ifdef CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL
   12588             : 
   12589             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CATCH_REQUIRE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12590             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_FALSE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CATCH_REQUIRE_FALSE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal | Catch::ResultDisposition::FalseTest, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12591             : 
   12592             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS( "CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, "", __VA_ARGS__ )
   12593             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_AS( "CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, expr )
   12594             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( expr, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_STR_MATCHES( "CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, matcher, expr )
   12595             : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_MATCHERS)
   12596             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_MATCHES( expr, exceptionType, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_MATCHES( "CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_MATCHES", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, matcher, expr )
   12597             : #endif// CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_MATCHERS
   12598             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_NOTHROW( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_NO_THROW( "CATCH_REQUIRE_NOTHROW", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12599             : 
   12600             : #define CATCH_CHECK( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CATCH_CHECK", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12601             : #define CATCH_CHECK_FALSE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CATCH_CHECK_FALSE", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure | Catch::ResultDisposition::FalseTest, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12602             : #define CATCH_CHECKED_IF( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_IF( "CATCH_CHECKED_IF", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12603             : #define CATCH_CHECKED_ELSE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_ELSE( "CATCH_CHECKED_ELSE", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12604             : #define CATCH_CHECK_NOFAIL( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CATCH_CHECK_NOFAIL", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure | Catch::ResultDisposition::SuppressFail, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12605             : 
   12606             : #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS( ... )  INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS( "CATCH_CHECK_THROWS", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, "", __VA_ARGS__ )
   12607             : #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_AS( "CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_AS", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, expr )
   12608             : #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_WITH( expr, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_STR_MATCHES( "CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_WITH", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, matcher, expr )
   12609             : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_MATCHERS)
   12610             : #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_MATCHES( expr, exceptionType, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_MATCHES( "CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_MATCHES", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, matcher, expr )
   12611             : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_MATCHERS
   12612             : #define CATCH_CHECK_NOTHROW( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_NO_THROW( "CATCH_CHECK_NOTHROW", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12613             : 
   12614             : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_MATCHERS)
   12615             : #define CATCH_CHECK_THAT( arg, matcher ) INTERNAL_CHECK_THAT( "CATCH_CHECK_THAT", matcher, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, arg )
   12616             : 
   12617             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THAT( arg, matcher ) INTERNAL_CHECK_THAT( "CATCH_REQUIRE_THAT", matcher, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, arg )
   12618             : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_MATCHERS
   12619             : 
   12620             : #define CATCH_INFO( msg ) INTERNAL_CATCH_INFO( "CATCH_INFO", msg )
   12621             : #define CATCH_WARN( msg ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "CATCH_WARN", Catch::ResultWas::Warning, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, msg )
   12622             : #define CATCH_CAPTURE( msg ) INTERNAL_CATCH_INFO( "CATCH_CAPTURE", #msg " := " << ::Catch::Detail::stringify(msg) )
   12623             : 
   12624             : #define CATCH_TEST_CASE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE( __VA_ARGS__ )
   12625             : #define CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12626             : #define CATCH_METHOD_AS_TEST_CASE( method, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_METHOD_AS_TEST_CASE( method, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12627             : #define CATCH_REGISTER_TEST_CASE( Function, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_REGISTER_TESTCASE( Function, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12628             : #define CATCH_SECTION( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_SECTION( __VA_ARGS__ )
   12629             : #define CATCH_FAIL( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "CATCH_FAIL", Catch::ResultWas::ExplicitFailure, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12630             : #define CATCH_FAIL_CHECK( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "CATCH_FAIL_CHECK", Catch::ResultWas::ExplicitFailure, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12631             : #define CATCH_SUCCEED( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "CATCH_SUCCEED", Catch::ResultWas::Ok, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12632             : 
   12633             : #define CATCH_ANON_TEST_CASE() INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE()
   12634             : 
   12635             : // "BDD-style" convenience wrappers
   12636             : #define CATCH_SCENARIO( ... ) CATCH_TEST_CASE( "Scenario: " __VA_ARGS__ )
   12637             : #define CATCH_SCENARIO_METHOD( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, "Scenario: " __VA_ARGS__ )
   12638             : #define CATCH_GIVEN( desc )    CATCH_SECTION( std::string( "Given: ") + desc )
   12639             : #define CATCH_WHEN( desc )     CATCH_SECTION( std::string( " When: ") + desc )
   12640             : #define CATCH_AND_WHEN( desc ) CATCH_SECTION( std::string( "  And: ") + desc )
   12641             : #define CATCH_THEN( desc )     CATCH_SECTION( std::string( " Then: ") + desc )
   12642             : #define CATCH_AND_THEN( desc ) CATCH_SECTION( std::string( "  And: ") + desc )
   12643             : 
   12644             : // If CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL is not defined then the CATCH_ prefix is not required
   12645             : #else
   12646             : 
   12647             : #define REQUIRE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "REQUIRE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__  )
   12648             : #define REQUIRE_FALSE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "REQUIRE_FALSE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal | Catch::ResultDisposition::FalseTest, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12649             : 
   12650             : #define REQUIRE_THROWS( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS( "REQUIRE_THROWS", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ )
   12651             : #define REQUIRE_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_AS( "REQUIRE_THROWS_AS", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, expr )

   12655             : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_MATCHERS
   12656             : #define REQUIRE_NOTHROW( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_NO_THROW( "REQUIRE_NOTHROW", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ )

   12676             : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_MATCHERS

   12700             : #define GIVEN( desc )    SECTION( std::string("   Given: ") + desc )

   12702             : #define AND_WHEN( desc ) SECTION( std::string("And when: ") + desc )
   12703             : #define THEN( desc )     SECTION( std::string("    Then: ") + desc )
   12704             : #define AND_THEN( desc ) SECTION( std::string("     And: ") + desc )

   12708             : #else

   12712             : 
   12713             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE( ... )        (void)(0)
   12714             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_FALSE( ... )  (void)(0)
   12715             : 
   12716             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS( ... ) (void)(0)
   12717             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) (void)(0)

   12727             : #define CATCH_CHECKED_ELSE( ... )  if (!(__VA_ARGS__))
